Chapter 79: Retribution

original: 11 惡報部(七〇)惡報部第十一夫有形則影現。
analyzed: 11 惡報部(七〇)惡報部第十一夫有形則影現。
translated: Evil Retribution, Part 11. When there is form, a shadow appears.
When there is sound, an echo responds.
Never seen form persist while the shadow disappears.
Sound continues while the echo diverges.
The principle of the mutual retribution of good and evil is clear.
I sincerely hope you will deeply believe and not doubt the coming criticism.
The light and heavy bitter retributions are fully described below.
If one personally kills living beings,
or flay, slice, roast, or steam clams and oysters,
or fly kites, run dogs, or shoot and hunt living beings,
one will fall into the hell of butchers, splitters, and butchers.
Those who steam, boil, burn, and roast living beings
will fall into the hell of cauldrons and charcoal pits.
Because of this killing of living beings,
in the hells,
for years and eons,
one will fully experience intense suffering.
After experiencing suffering,
one will again fall into the animal realm.

original: 作諸牛馬猪羊驢騾𩥟駝鷄狗魚鳥󱩝𭻝蛤蟍為人所殺。
analyzed: 作諸牛馬猪羊驢騾𩥟駝鷄狗魚鳥󱩝𭻝蛤蟍為人所殺。
translated: They become cows, horses, pigs, sheep, donkeys, mules, camels, chickens, dogs, fish, birds, turtles, and clams, and are killed by people.
They do not get to live out their natural lifespan.
They still use their own flesh to fill the table.
In this way, they transmigrate through countless lives as animals.
If they do not have the slightest bit of good karma, they will never escape.
If they have a small amount of merit and are reborn as humans,
they may miscarry in the womb.
They may die shortly after birth.
Some die at ten or twenty years old.
They have not learned anything.
They go from darkness to darkness.
People feel sorry for them.
Know that short lifespans are all due to killing.

analyzed: 又地持論云。 殺生之罪。
translated: The Di Chi Lun says:
The sin of killing can cause sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn as a human, they will receive two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, a short lifespan.

analyzed: 二者多病。 如是十惡。
translated: Second, many illnesses.
Thus, each of the ten evil deeds has five kinds of karmic retribution:

original: 一者殺生何故受地獄苦。
analyzed: 一者殺生何故受地獄苦。
translated: First, why do those who kill experience suffering in hell?
Because killing sentient beings causes suffering to sentient beings.

original: 所以身壞命終地獄眾苦皆來切己。
analyzed: 所以身壞命終地獄眾苦皆來切己。
translated: Therefore, when the body perishes and life ends, the various sufferings of hell all come to afflict oneself.

original: 二者殺生何故出為畜生。
analyzed: 二者殺生何故出為畜生。
translated: Second, why does killing lead to rebirth as an animal?

original: 以殺生無有慈惻行乖人倫。
analyzed: 以殺生無有慈惻行乖人倫。
translated: Because killing lacks compassion and goes against human ethics.
Therefore, after the hellish sins are exhausted, one receives an animal body.

original: 三者殺生何故復為餓鬼。
analyzed: 三者殺生何故復為餓鬼。
translated: Third, why does killing lead to rebirth as a hungry ghost?

original: 以其殺生必緣慳心貪著滋味。
analyzed: 以其殺生必緣慳心貪著滋味。
translated: Because killing necessarily arises from a stingy mind and attachment to flavors.
One is further reborn as a hungry ghost.

original: 四者殺生何故生人而得短壽。
analyzed: 四者殺生何故生人而得短壽。
translated: Fourth, why does killing lead to a short life even if reborn as a human?

original: 以其殺生殘害物命故得短壽。
analyzed: 以其殺生殘害物命故得短壽。
translated: Because killing harms the lives of others, one obtains a short life.

original: 五者殺生何故兼得多病。
analyzed: 五者殺生何故兼得多病。
translated: Fifth, why does killing also lead to much illness?

original: 以殺生違適眾患競集故得多病。
analyzed: 以殺生違適眾患競集故得多病。
translated: Because killing goes against the harmony of all beings, many calamities compete to gather, and one obtains much illness.
One should know that killing is a great suffering.
Moreover, the Za bao zang jing says:
At that time, there was a ghost.
He said to Maudgalyāyana:
I always have eyes on my shoulders.
My chest has a mouth and nose.
I am always without a head.
What are the causes and conditions for this?
Maudgalyāyana replied,
In your past life,
you were always a disciple of an executioner.

original: 若殺人時汝常有歡喜心。
analyzed: 若殺人時汝常有歡喜心。
translated: Whenever someone was killed, you always had a joyful mind.
You would pull on the rope tied to their topknot.
Because of these causes and conditions, you are experiencing this punishment.
This is the retribution of evil deeds in the form of flowers.

original: 地獄苦果方在後也。🔽復有一鬼。
analyzed: 地獄苦果方在後也。 復有一鬼。
translated: The fruit of suffering in the hells is yet to come.
There was another ghost who said to Maudgalyāyana,
My body is always like a lump of meat.
It has no hands, feet, eyes, ears, nose, or other [body parts].
I am constantly eaten by insects and birds.
The suffering of my sins is difficult to bear.
What are the causes and conditions for this?
He replied,
In your past life,
you always gave others medicine to abort their babies.
Because of this, you are experiencing this punishment.
This is the retribution in the form of flowers.
The fruit of suffering in the hells is yet to come in your next life.
Moreover, because of killing living beings, greed, and excessive harm,
because of excessive greed,
there was no righteousness or yielding,
and one engaged in robbery.
If in this life one steals and takes what is not given,
Upon death one will fall into the Iron Cave Hell.
For eons one will experience various sufferings.
After completing the suffering, one will fall into the animal realm.
One's body will always bear heavy burdens, be driven and whipped.
Without any rest, the flavors one eats
Will only be water and grass.
Dwelling in this realm for immeasurable lifetimes,
Due to past causes and conditions,
If one encounters slight goodness and regains a human body,
One will always be a servant.
Driven to run errands,
One will not have freedom.
Until debts are repaid,
One will not be able to hear the Dharma.
Due to this, one will experience suffering and transmigration endlessly.
Know that this suffering is all due to stealing.

original: 今身隱蔽人光明。🔽不以光明供養三寶。
analyzed: 今身隱蔽人光明。 不以光明供養三寶。
translated: If in this life one obscures the light of others,🔽And does not offer one's own light to the Three Jewels,

original: 反取三寶光明以用自照。
analyzed: 反取三寶光明以用自照。
translated: But instead takes the light of the Three Jewels to illuminate oneself,

original: 死即當墮黑耳黑繩黑暗地獄。
analyzed: 死即當墮黑耳黑繩黑暗地獄。
translated: Upon death one will fall into the Black Ear, Black Rope, or Dark Hell.
For eons one will experience various sufferings.
After suffering is exhausted, they fall into lice.
They cannot bear the light.
In this state, there are immeasurable births and deaths.
Due to past causes and conditions,

original: 若遇微善劣復人身。🔽形容黶黑垢膩不淨。
analyzed: 若遇微善劣復人身。 形容黶黑垢膩不淨。
translated: if they encounter slight goodness and again obtain a human body,🔽their appearance will be dark, dirty, impure,
smelly, and filthy, causing people to dislike and distance themselves.
Both eyes will be blind, unable to see the heavens and earth.

original: 當知隱蔽光明亦緣偷盜故。
analyzed: 當知隱蔽光明亦緣偷盜故。
translated: Know that obscuring light is also due to stealing.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:
The crime of robbery
also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn as a human, they obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
first, poverty;
second, being unable to freely enjoy shared wealth.
Why does robbery lead to falling into hell?

original: 以其劫盜剝奪偷竊人財苦眾生故。
analyzed: 以其劫盜剝奪偷竊人財苦眾生故。
translated: Because robbery, theft, and plundering of others' wealth causes suffering for sentient beings,
upon death, one immediately enters the cold ice hell.
One experiences all kinds of suffering.
Why does robbery lead to being reborn as an animal?

original: 以其不行人道故受畜生報。
analyzed: 以其不行人道故受畜生報。
translated: Because one does not follow the human way, one receives the retribution of being an animal.

original: 身常負重以肉供人償其宿債。
analyzed: 身常負重以肉供人償其宿債。
translated: The body always carries heavy burdens, providing flesh for others to repay its past debts.
Why did he fall into the realm of hungry ghosts?
Because of stinginess and greed, he committed robbery and theft.

original: 是以畜生罪畢復為餓鬼。
analyzed: 是以畜生罪畢復為餓鬼。
translated: Therefore, after exhausting the karma of the animal realm, he became a hungry ghost again.
Why is he poor among humans?
Because his robbery and theft left others empty and destitute.
That is why he is poor.
Why is he not free to enjoy shared wealth?
Because of his robbery and theft.

original: 設若有財則為五家所共。
analyzed: 設若有財則為五家所共。
translated: If he has any wealth, it is shared by the five families.
He is not free.
Know that robbery and theft are two great sufferings.
The Za bao zang jing says:
At that time there was a ghost.
He said to Maudgalyāyana:
Virtuous One.
My belly is extremely large like a jar.
My throat, hands and feet are very thin like a needle.
I cannot get food or drink.
For what reason do I suffer like this?
Maudgalyāyana replied:
In your past life, you were the head of a village.
You relied on your power and status to eat and drink to excess.
And they despise and deceive other people.
They take away their food and drink.
They starve sentient beings.
Because of these causes and conditions,
They receive such punishments.
This is the flower retribution.

original: 地獄苦果方在後也。🔽復有一鬼。
analyzed: 地獄苦果方在後也。 復有一鬼。
translated: The suffering of the hells is yet to come.
There was another ghost who said to Maudgalyāyana,

original: 常有二熱鐵輪在我兩腋下轉。
analyzed: 常有二熱鐵輪在我兩腋下轉。
translated: There are always two hot iron wheels turning on my two armpits,
Burning my body.
For what causes and conditions is this so?
Maudgalyāyana replied,
When you were in the world, you made cakes for the Sangha,
But you stole two portions and put them under your armpits.
Therefore, you receive such punishments.
This is the flower retribution.
Later, you will receive the painful retribution of the hells.
Moreover, because of stealing, your mind is not upright.

analyzed: 恣情婬妷。 今身婬妷。
translated: You indulge in lust.🔽In this life, you are lustful.
You are always in danger.
You are always in fear,
Or you are known as the other woman of your husband's.

analyzed: 臨時得殃。 刀杖加形。
translated: At the right time, you will suffer misfortune.🔽Your body will be struck with knives and sticks,
And your head and feet will be severed.
Even to the point of losing one's life.
After death, one enters hell.
Lying on an iron bed.
Or embracing a copper pillar.
The ghosts of hell set fire.
To burn one's body.
After the sins in hell are exhausted, one will next receive an animal body.
Chickens, ducks, birds, sparrows, dogs, pigs, flying moths.
Such immeasurable births and deaths.
In the distant kalpas, one will experience various sufferings.
After experiencing the sufferings,
due to the original causes and conditions.
If one encounters a slight wholesome action and regains a human body.
Adultery in the inner quarters, wives and concubines are unfaithful.
If one has affection for someone, one is robbed by others.
Always harboring fear.
Many dangers, little peace.
Know that the dangers and sufferings all arise from sexual misconduct.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:

original: 邪婬之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 邪婬之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of sexual misconduct also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn among humans, one obtains two kinds of karmic retribution.
First, one's wife is unchaste.
Second, one obtains relatives who do not act as one wishes.
Why does sexual misconduct cause one to fall into hell?

original: 以其邪婬干犯非分侵物為苦。
analyzed: 以其邪婬干犯非分侵物為苦。
translated: The suffering of sexual misconduct is due to violating others' spouses and taking what is not given.
Therefore, after death, one receives the suffering of hell.
Why does sexual misconduct lead to rebirth as an animal?
Because sexual misconduct goes against human principles.
Therefore, after leaving hell, one receives the body of an animal.
Why does sexual misconduct lead to rebirth as a hungry ghost?
Because all sexual misconduct is caused by stinginess and attachment.
Due to the sin of stinginess and attachment, one is reborn as a hungry ghost.
Why do those who engage in sexual misconduct not have chaste wives?
Because they violate others' spouses.
The wives they obtain are always unchaste.

original: 何故邪婬不得隨意眷屬。
analyzed: 何故邪婬不得隨意眷屬。
translated: Why do those who engage in sexual misconduct not get to choose their own relatives?
Because their sexual misconduct takes away others' affection and favor.
Therefore, they do not get to choose their own relatives.
That is why they are also taken away by others.
One should know that sexual misconduct is the third great suffering.
Moreover, the Za bao zang jing says:
In the past, there was a ghost.
He said to Maudgalyāyana:
I cover my head with a cloth.
I am always afraid that people will come to kill me.
My heart is always in terror and cannot bear it.
For what reasons is this so?
He replied:
In your past life, you lusted after and had sex with others.
You were always afraid of being seen by people.
Or you were afraid that your husband would catch you, beat you, or kill you.
Or you were afraid of being executed in the marketplace by the authorities.
You were always fearful and anxious, fearful and anxious in succession.
Therefore, you receive this kind of punishment.
This is the retribution of evil deeds in this life.
Later, you will receive the retribution of suffering in hell.

original: 又緣其邪婬故發言皆妄。
analyzed: 又緣其邪婬故發言皆妄。
translated: Moreover, because of your sexual misconduct, your words are all false.
In this life, if you deceive and torment sentient beings,
after death you will fall into the wailing hell.
For eons, you will experience various sufferings.
After completing your suffering, you will fall into the realm of hungry ghosts.
In this suffering, you will experience immeasurable birth and death.
Due to your past causes and conditions,

original: 若遇微善劣復人身。🔽多諸疾病尫羸虛弱。
analyzed: 若遇微善劣復人身。 多諸疾病尫羸虛弱。
translated: if you encounter a slight bit of goodness, you will be reborn as a human again.🔽You will have many illnesses, be weak and frail.
You will suffer from severe pain and torment yourself with misery.
People do not love and cherish them.
One should know that this suffering is all due to false speech.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:

original: 妄語之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 妄語之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of false speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn among humans, one obtains two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, being slandered by many;
Second, being deceived by others.
Why does false speech lead to falling into hell?
Because false speech is not true,
It causes people to experience suffering for no reason.
Therefore, upon death, one receives the suffering of hell.
Why does false speech lead to being reborn as an animal?
Because deception goes against people's sincerity and trust,
One thus receives the retribution of being an animal upon leaving hell.
Why does false speech lead to being a hungry ghost?
Because false speech is all due to greed and deception,
The sin of stinginess and deception leads one to become a hungry ghost again.
Why are those who speak falsely often slandered by others?
Because false speech is not sincere and true.
Why are those who speak falsely deceived by others?
Because false speech deceives and induces others.
One should know that false speech is the suffering of the four great elements.
Moreover, because of false speech, one will engage in divisive speech.
In this life, one's words lack kindness and love.
Slandering, defaming, reviling, and speaking harshly and in confusion.

original: 死即當墮拔舌烊銅犁耕地獄。
analyzed: 死即當墮拔舌烊銅犁耕地獄。
translated: After death, one will fall into the Avīci Hell where one's tongue is pulled out and plowed with molten copper.
For eons, one will experience various sufferings.
After completing the suffering, one will fall into the animal realm.
Eating feces and filth.
Like a pelican.
Because of having a tongue.
In this realm, there are immeasurable births and deaths.
Due to the original causes and conditions.
If one encounters slight goodness.
Inferiorly reborn as a human body.

analyzed: 舌根不具。 口氣臭惡。
translated: The tongue faculty is incomplete.🔽The breath is foul-smelling.
Dumb, mute, and stammering.
The teeth are not even and white.
The hair is sparse and thin.
If there are good words.
People do not believe them.
One should know that slander and chaos all arise from divisive speech.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:

original: 兩舌之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 兩舌之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of divisive speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn as a human, one obtains two kinds of karmic retribution.
First, one obtains a bad and evil retinue.
Second, one obtains an inharmonious retinue.
Why does slander lead to falling into hell?
Because of slander, one separates people from their loved ones.
Because of the suffering of separation and love, one experiences the suffering of hell.
Why does slander lead to becoming an animal?
Because of slander, one fights and causes chaos.
It is the same as a wild fox, and one receives an animal body.
Why does slander lead to becoming a hungry ghost?
Because of slander, one is also stingy and jealous.
Because of the sin of stinginess and jealousy, one becomes a hungry ghost again.

original: 何故兩舌為人得弊惡眷屬。
analyzed: 何故兩舌為人得弊惡眷屬。
translated: Why does slander lead to obtaining a bad and evil retinue as a human?

original: 緣以兩舌使人良儔皆生惡故。
analyzed: 緣以兩舌使人良儔皆生惡故。
translated: Because of slander, one causes even good companions to give rise to evil.
Why does slander lead to an inharmonious retinue?

original: 緣以兩舌離人親好使不和合故。
analyzed: 緣以兩舌離人親好使不和合故。
translated: Because of slander, one separates people from their loved ones and causes them to be disharmonious.

original: 當知兩舌五大苦也。🔽又緣其兩舌言輒麁惡。
analyzed: 當知兩舌五大苦也。 又緣其兩舌言輒麁惡。
translated: One should know that slander is the fifth great suffering.🔽Moreover, because of slander, one's words are coarse and evil.
In this life, because of harsh speech, one
Causing disputes and harm.
Attacking each other.
Killing various beings.
Upon death, one will fall into the hells of weapons and warfare.
For a long eon, one will experience various sufferings.
After completing the sufferings, one will fall into the animal realm.
Pulling legs, selling bladders, paying with thighs, losing shoulder blades.
For a long eon, one will experience various sufferings.
After completing the sufferings,
one will be in this realm.
With immeasurable birth and death.
Due to the original causes and conditions,
if one encounters slight goodness,
one will again obtain a human body.
But with incomplete four limbs.
Having the nose cut off, the feet cut off, the lips cut off, the ears cut off.
The body is mutilated and damaged.
Not protected by ghosts and spirits.
Disregarded by others.

original: 當知殘害眾生皆緣惡口。
analyzed: 當知殘害眾生皆緣惡口。
translated: Know that harming beings is all due to evil speech.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:

original: 惡口之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道若生人中得二種果報。
analyzed: 惡口之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道若生人中得二種果報。
translated: The sin of evil speech also causes beings to fall into the three evil paths. If reborn as a human, one will obtain two kinds of consequences:
First, always hearing bad sounds.

original: 二者所可言說常有諍訟。
analyzed: 二者所可言說常有諍訟。
translated: Second, whatever one says will always be disputed.
Why does speaking harshly lead to falling into hell?
Because speaking harshly all wishes to harm others.
People hear it as suffering.
Therefore, upon death, one receives the suffering of hell.
Why does speaking harshly lead to becoming an animal?

original: 以其惡口罵人以為畜生。
analyzed: 以其惡口罵人以為畜生。
translated: Because speaking harshly insults others as animals.
Therefore, upon leaving hell, one becomes an animal.
Why does speaking harshly lead to becoming a hungry ghost?
Because of stinginess and resentment, one then scolds.

original: 所以畜生苦畢復為餓鬼。
analyzed: 所以畜生苦畢復為餓鬼。
translated: Therefore, after the suffering of being an animal is finished, one again becomes a hungry ghost.

original: 何故惡口為人常聞惡音。
analyzed: 何故惡口為人常聞惡音。
translated: Why does speaking harshly lead to always hearing bad sounds as a human?

original: 以其發言麁鄙所聞常惡。
analyzed: 以其發言麁鄙所聞常惡。
translated: Because the words spoken are coarse and vulgar, and what is heard is always bad.

original: 何故惡口所可言說常有諍訟。
analyzed: 何故惡口所可言說常有諍訟。
translated: Why does speaking harshly lead to always having disputes in what is said?
Because speaking harshly goes against the many virtues.
Whatever is said always leads to disputes.
Know that speaking harshly is the sixth great suffering.
Moreover, because of speaking harshly, words are frivolous and ornate.
There is no meaning or benefit at all.

original: 無義益故今身則生憍慢。
analyzed: 無義益故今身則生憍慢。
translated: Because there is no meaning or benefit, the present body then gives rise to arrogance.
Upon death, one will fall into the Bound Hell.
For a long eon, one will experience various sufferings.
After completing the suffering, one will fall into the animal realm.

original: 唯念水草不識父母恩養。
analyzed: 唯念水草不識父母恩養。
translated: Only thinking of water and grass, not recognizing the kindness of parents.
In this state, there are immeasurable births and deaths.
By the original causes and conditions.
If one encounters slight goodness.
Inferiorly, one regains a human body.
Born in a borderland.
Not knowing loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness.
Not seeing the Three Jewels.
If in a central country.
Short and ugly.
Despised by others.

original: 當知憍慢皆緣無義調戲不節。
analyzed: 當知憍慢皆緣無義調戲不節。
translated: One should know that arrogance is all due to meaningless jokes and lack of restraint.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Concentration says:

original: 無義語罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 無義語罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of meaningless speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn as a human, one obtains two kinds of karmic retribution:

original: 一者所有言語人不信受。
analyzed: 一者所有言語人不信受。
translated: First, others do not believe or accept one's words.

original: 二者有所言說不能明了。
analyzed: 二者有所言說不能明了。
translated: Second, one's speech is unclear.
Why does meaningless speech lead to falling into hell?
Since speech is meaningless, it harms others.
Therefore, upon death, one will experience the suffering of hell.
Why does meaningless speech lead to rebirth as an animal?
Because meaningless speech violates human ethics and principles.
Therefore, upon leaving hell, one receives the body of an animal.
Why does meaningless speech lead to rebirth as a hungry ghost?
Because meaningless speech is caused by stinginess and delusion.
Because of stinginess and delusion, one is reborn as a hungry ghost again.

original: 何故無義語罪出生為人。
analyzed: 何故無義語罪出生為人。
translated: Why does the sin of meaningless speech lead to rebirth as a human?
Whatever one says, people do not believe or accept it.
Because meaningless speech is not acceptable.

original: 何故無義語有所言說不能明了。
analyzed: 何故無義語有所言說不能明了。
translated: Why is it that due to meaningless speech, whatever one says cannot be clearly understood?
Because meaningless speech is all based on obscurity.
The retribution of obscurity is that one cannot understand clearly.
Know that meaningless speech is the seventh great suffering.

original: 又緣無義語故不能廉讓。
analyzed: 又緣無義語故不能廉讓。
translated: Moreover, because of meaningless speech, one cannot be humble and yielding.
Causing greed and desire to be insatiable.
In this life, being stingy and greedy, not giving in charity.
Upon death, one will fall into the boiling excrement hell.
In the distant kalpa, one will experience various sufferings and afflictions.

original: 受苦既畢墮畜生餓鬼中。
analyzed: 受苦既畢墮畜生餓鬼中。
translated: After suffering is exhausted, they fall into the realms of animals and hungry ghosts.
Having no clothes or food, they depend on others for support.
They eat filth.
They do not receive what is not given.
In this realm, there are immeasurable births and deaths.
Due to past causes and conditions,
if they encounter slight goodness,
they are reborn as a human being again.
But they are hungry, cold, and naked,
always destitute.
Even if others do not give to them,
they seek and cannot obtain.
Even if there is a tiny bit, they immediately encounter confiscation.
They suffer hardship without direction, losing their lives.

original: 當知此不布施皆緣貪欲。
analyzed: 當知此不布施皆緣貪欲。
translated: Know that this lack of giving is all due to greed and desire.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Yoga Practice says:

original: 貪欲之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 貪欲之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of greed and desire also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If reborn as a human, they obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, having many desires;
Second, being insatiable.
Why do those with greed and desire fall into hell?
Because of their greed and desire, they move their bodies and mouths,
and inflict suffering on others.
Therefore, when their bodies die, they receive the suffering of hell.
Why does lust lead to rebirth as an animal?
Because this lust leads to agitation, deviating from human norms.
Therefore, upon leaving prison, one becomes an animal.
Why does lust also lead to rebirth as a hungry ghost?
Because this lust leads to grasping and stinginess.
Due to the sin of grasping and stinginess, one is reborn as a hungry ghost.
Why does lust also lead to excessive desire?
Because this lust leads to increasingly more desires.
Why does lust lead to insatiable desire?
Because this lust leads to insatiable craving.
Know that lust is the eighth great suffering.
Moreover, because of lust, when things do not go one's way,
one becomes angry and gives rise to hatred.
If one is often angry in this life,
upon death one will fall into the hells of the Niraya hell.
For eons one will experience various sufferings.
After experiencing the sufferings, one will fall into the animal realm.
One will become a poisonous snake, scorpion, tiger, leopard, wolf,
or jackal, experiencing countless births and deaths within this realm.
Due to the original causes and conditions,
If one encounters a slight good deed,
One will again obtain a human body.
But one will have much anger,
And one's facial appearance will be ugly and evil.
One will be hated by people.
Not only will one not be intimate with friends,
But one's eyes will not delight in seeing them.
One should know that anger and resentment all arise from hatred and vexation.
Therefore, the Di-chi lun says:

original: 瞋恚之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 瞋恚之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of anger also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If one is born among humans, one obtains two kinds of karmic retribution:

original: 一者常為一切求其長短。
analyzed: 一者常為一切求其長短。
translated: First, one is always sought after by others to find one's strengths and weaknesses.

original: 二者常為眾人之所惱害。
analyzed: 二者常為眾人之所惱害。
translated: Second, one is always harmed by the masses.
Why does anger and resentment lead to falling into hell?
Because of this anger and resentment, one harms sentient beings with vexation.

analyzed: 受地獄苦。 何故瞋惱。
translated: One receives the suffering of hell.
Why does anger and resentment lead to being reborn as an animal?
Because of this anger and resentment, one is unable to be kind and forgiving.
Therefore, one leaves hell and receives the body of an animal.
Why does anger and resentment lead to being a hungry ghost again?
Because of this anger and resentment, it arises from a stingy mind.
Because of the sin of a stingy mind, one is again a hungry ghost.
Why be angry?
Always seeking others' shortcomings.
Because of this anger, one cannot tolerate others.
Therefore, one always seeks others' shortcomings.

original: 何故瞋惱常為眾人之所惱害。
analyzed: 何故瞋惱常為眾人之所惱害。
translated: Why be angry? Always causing others to be troubled and harmed.
Because of this anger, one troubles and harms others.
People also trouble and harm one.
One should know that anger is the ninth great suffering.
Moreover, because of anger and resentment, one harbors perversity.
One does not believe in the right path.
In this life, one's wrong views block others from listening to the Dharma.
When reciting sutras, one does not absorb the teachings oneself.
After death, one will fall into the deaf and stupid hells.
For a long eon, one will experience various sufferings.
After the suffering is over, one will fall into the animal realm.
Hearing the sounds of the Three Jewels and the Four Truths,
one does not know they are good.
The sounds of killing, beating, and striking,
one does not know they are evil.
In this realm, there are immeasurable births and deaths.
Due to one's past causes and conditions,
if one encounters slight goodness,
one regains a human body.
If born as a human, they will be deaf and blind, not hearing.
No different from stone walls.
They will never be aware of beautiful words and good sounds.

original: 當知阻礙聽法皆緣邪見。
analyzed: 當知阻礙聽法皆緣邪見。
translated: Know that obstructing listening to the Dharma is all due to wrong views.
Therefore, the Treatise on the Stages of Concentration says:

original: 邪見之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
analyzed: 邪見之罪亦令眾生墮三惡道。
translated: The sin of wrong views also causes sentient beings to fall into the three evil paths.
If born as a human, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution.
First, being born in a family with wrong views.
Second, their minds will be deceitful.
Why do those with wrong views fall into hell?

original: 緣以邪見唯向邪道及以神俗。
analyzed: 緣以邪見唯向邪道及以神俗。
translated: Because those with wrong views only go towards wrong paths and spirits,
slandering the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, not revering the Three Jewels.
Since they do not have faith and cut off the right path for others,
they will suffer.
Therefore, when their lives end, they enter Avīci Hell.
Why do those with wrong views become animals?
Because those with wrong views do not recognize the correct principles,
they receive the retribution of being an animal after leaving hell.
Why do those with wrong views become hungry ghosts?
Because those with wrong views have a firm attachment to stinginess,
And do not abandon deviant and perverse views.
Do not abandon stinginess and attachment.
And are reborn as hungry ghosts.
Why are those with wrong views born in families with wrong views?
Because of these wrong views, deviant and perverse thoughts entangle the mind.
Therefore, they are born in families with wrong views.
Why are those with wrong views deceitful in mind?
Because of these wrong views, they are not upright.
Therefore, their minds are always deceitful.
One should know that wrong views are the tenth great suffering.

original: 如是一一微細眾惡罪業無量無邊。
analyzed: 如是一一微細眾惡罪業無量無邊。
translated: In this way, each and every subtle evil and sinful karma is immeasurable and boundless.
All enter hell and experience various sufferings.
It cannot be known by counting.
It is only briefly mentioned.

original: 若能返惡為善即是我師。

analyzed: 受罪短命死　　驚恐遭暴患

analyzed: 婬為不淨行　　迷惑失正道

original: 形消魂魄驚　　傷命而早夭

analyzed: 受罪頑癡荒　　死復墮惡道

I dare not speak harshly.

analyzed: 欺者有四過　　讒佞傷賢良
translated: The deceitful have four faults, slandering and injuring the virtuous and good,

analyzed: 受身癡聾𮋾　　謇吃口臭腥
translated: Stammering, and a foul-smelling mouth.

original: 顛狂不能信　　死墮拔舌耕
analyzed: 顛狂不能信　　死墮拔舌耕
translated: One will become insane and unable to believe, and after death will fall into the hells with a plow ripping out one's tongue.

original: 吾修四淨口　　自致八音聲
analyzed: 吾修四淨口　　自致八音聲
translated: I cultivate the four pure mouths and attain the eight sounds.

original: 主成諸惡王道毀仁澤滅。

original: 醉者為不孝　　怨禍從內生
analyzed: 醉者為不孝　　怨禍從內生

original: 迷惑清高士　　亂德敗淑貞
analyzed: 迷惑清高士　　亂德敗淑貞
translated: They confuse the pure and lofty ones and disturb the virtues of the virtuous and chaste.

original: 故吾不飲酒　　慈心濟群氓
analyzed: 故吾不飲酒　　慈心濟群氓
translated: Therefore, I do not drink alcohol, and with a compassionate mind, I deliver the masses.

original: 淨慧度八難　　自致覺道成
analyzed: 淨慧度八難　　自致覺道成

gray hair and falling teeth,
blindness when looking,
deafness when listening,

aching in the hundred joints,

analyzed: 吾念世無常　　人生要當老

analyzed: 盛去日衰羸　　形枯而白首

translated: In the Song dynasty, Zhang Bi of Xiapi was burned to death by his neighbor. The neighbor received retribution in the present life.
Zhang Bi's family had been prominent for generations.
But in later years, they declined.
He had a granddaughter.
She was beautiful and attractive.
A neighbor asked to marry her as a concubine.
Pi considered himself a descendant of an old family.
He was ashamed and did not agree.
The neighbor was angry and set fire to his house.
Pi was burned to death.
His son Bang was away and not there.
Later, when he returned, he also knew the situation.
But he feared the neighbor's power.
And he coveted his wealth and did not speak out.
He married his daughter to him.
Later, after a year, Bang dreamed that Pi said:
You, my son, are disobedient to heaven and unfilial.
You abandoned your relatives and went to a stranger.
You colluded with a criminal gang.
He grabbed Bang's head.
And stabbed him with a peach-wood staff in his hand.
Bang then fell ill for two nights and vomited blood to death.
On the day Bang died.
The neighbor also saw Pi pushing open the door and going straight in.
With eyes wide open and sleeves rolled up, he said:
You rely on your nobility and indulge in evil to the extreme.
You unjustly caused him to be killed.
I have already appealed and my case has been approved.
After a few days, you will know.
The neighbor fell ill and soon died as well.

He said:

After returning, at the third watch,
he saw Lu Qingzu come and say:

He dragged me to the back door.
When I was first killed,
the attendants who were with me were also in it.

I have already nailed his head to the wall.

He secretly looked at the wall where the slave was staying.
Sure enough, there was a handful of hair.
Nailed with bamboo.

The slave admitted to the crime when questioned.
He was also asked:
Since you are a rebel,
why didn't you run away?
The slave said:
My head feels as if it's tied up.

analyzed: 欲逃不得。 諸同見者。
translated: I want to escape but can't.

Tongda saw the monk carrying a scripture box.
He said,
Inside it is all silk and satin.
He then conspired with his wife to beat the monk to death.
Before the monk died,
he chanted a few lines of a spell.
Then a fly flew into his nose.
After a long time it did not come out.

After more than a year she also died.

he suddenly encountered a severe wind illness.

Recently, I was sent to Youzhou.
I encountered a guest bringing more than ten bolts of silk.
There was no one else around.

After more than twenty days,
the monk's body was still there.
At that time, it was the hot season.
I suspected that it had all rotted away.
I went to take a look.
It was as if it were the day he died.
